result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $100.00 plus applicable costs, surcharges and assessments by  9-01-16; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge.
with credit for 13 DAYS time served.

records.addlTxt: Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  
Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Sentencing.  Hearing proceed.  Statements made as to sentencing by the state, defense, and defendant.

COUNT 2:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 13 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 13 DAYS time served.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $100.00 plus applicable costs, surcharges and assessments by  9-01-16; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.  The Court ordered the defendant to provide a DNA sample - pay surcharge.
Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for sentencing.  Attorney Schubert had miscalendared the case.   Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg. Case adjourned for sentencing on 9/8/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 44.  aw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 03.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case was calendared for plea hearing this date.  Defense request for an adjourned date is granted by the court.  Any motions by the state are to be filed by 06-01-15 and any response by defense is to be filed by 06-04-15.  Final pretrial  date and jury trial date are to be selected on the next court date.  Parties are advised that effective 08-01-15 this case will be reassigned to Branch 44 Judge Konkel  Status conference scheduled for 06-15-2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  An issue arose to see if charge is eligible for the possibility of expunction in defendant's pending case.  Parties will research the issue.  Court grants parties request to adjourn plea and sentencing.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 5/14/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.   Defendant to continue with Justice Point supervision.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  State has given defense a new offer.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 5/6/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Defendant to continue to go to Justice Point.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  aw

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert who appears via telephone.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Meghan Wautier.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Case remains calendared for Plea and Sentencing  on April 21, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 3.

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

02-12-2015
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  Court takes no action.  Defendant was just released from jail, and walked over to Justice Point.  aw

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.  Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has just received discovery yesterday, and needs time to review it with defendant.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 3/2/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Joseph Schubert.  Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in custody.  David John Behm appeared for Antonella Aleman the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Terrance Lee Lawrence in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
